Reviews.Title: “Here I am again”
Reviews.Author: Antinmelb
Reviews.Content: Again another stay at this hotel, each time seems to get better. Still roomy still quiet, I found that the staff seemed to have changed and were even better than last time. My flight was delayed 3 hours, when I arrived at midnight, I was greeted by name and my room was ready for me with lights and the heater on, how often does that happen? Yes this is my home away from home in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: AnnGr
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for three nights in early January. The room was average, nothing special about it. Old TV and furnishings could use updating. Overall great location downtown for what we needed the room for. We were on the 10th floor and could hear the one of the air vents squeaking on top of the building all day and night. The tub could have been cleaner as there were several black hairs found attached to the plug in the drain. We were initially worried about bed bugs in the area - but we did a check before moving into the room and didn't find any or any evidence. Overall this location was good, and quality of the room was okay for the price paid. Not the best room for the price I have ever stayed in though... Would recommend to someone on a budget that needs to be close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011 Stay”
Reviews.Author: OurTracey
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews we were a little apprehensive about staying here but were more than pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly and helpful, especially at 11.30pm on the 1st night of our stay (Christmas eve) when we arrived back from our evening out to discover the toilet blocked. It took less than 10 minutes for them to move us to another room, which was equally spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds were really comfortable and whenever we asked for extra supplies of coffee, creamer etc; we were readily supplied with however much we wanted. The breakfast admittedly was basic but at least we were not charged extra for it. The hotel is well-situated for the tube station on Yonge/Bloor. There were notices around the building stating they were currently undergoing renovation - but being Christmas there was no evidence of workmen. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “no smoking as of Jan 1st”
Reviews.Author: guy1963
Reviews.Content: Just a heads up my wife and I have had a smoking room booked at this hotel for over a month for the weekend of Jan 12th 2012 . We wanted to to stay an extra day so we called to book it on jan 2nd. when we called the hotel to book the extra day we where told that as of Jan 1st there is no more smoking in the hotel. I think they could have told us that at the time of booking so if you have a smoking room booked you may want to look into a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of city”
Reviews.Author: ashisharya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just next to Chales St. Eat and Younge Street intersection. I stayed in this hotel for around 10 days. The rooms were simply great and cozy beds. Staff was very courteous and helped me in sightseeing as well, since I was new to the city. The hotel provides free breakfast and wi-fi throughout the hotel. The location of the hotel makes it the most interesting place. There are a lot of Indian food joints near the hotel as well. It is well connected to the Toronto Metro at the Bloor station which is just across the next street. You will find a great nightlife around the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Middle of City!”
Reviews.Author: gachen1
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I am not sure if some of the gripes I've read on TripAdvisor are still deserved. From check-in to questions while staying to check-out, the reception staffs have been friendly and helpful. We even asked for late check-out & was granted an extra hour. The rooms are "dated" but they're clean & spacious. We booked a room with 2 double beds & have plenty of space for our luggages, space in the closet & space to roam around & work. The heater & TV were working just fine, the shower was hot, the restroom was very clean & the bed comfortable. We also had a good view of the city from our room. The carpet may be "old-fashioned" but well-maintained. The hotel is minutes away from Bloor St. in Yorkville, restaurants (from expensive to reasonably priced), shops (from high-end boutiques to a Dollarama store) & the subway line. It was certainly a great value for such a great location & nice room. FYI breakfast consists of simple croissants, bread & orange juice/coffee but this was fine with us as well. Will most likely stay in this hotel the next time we're visiting downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, quiet with big nice rooms and bed”
Reviews.Author: ExploringFeet
Reviews.Content: Hi, As I checked in, fornt desk managers would help to store your luggage if there is time to check in as per the hotel check-in times. It is an absolutely clean, and comfortable place. The room will be cleaned everyday and you feel safe in the hotel. Breakfast was average..not great at all... Staff isnt very friendly as such to help you pick up the luggage if required, guess thats applicable in many countries except india, where you may have your luggage picked up by providing tip amount. The biggest advantage of this hotel ,is that you step out of the hotel and you have everything...literally everything...shops..food joints...theatres...so you dont feelk lonely in this area...you have lot of things to do... It is also right next to the subway , hence it is very very convenient ! Overall a very good place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and A Super Value!”
Reviews.Author: MissDHappy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and have reservations for upcoming trips. The rate is excellent (especially through CAA) and the location is ideal. It is right off bustling Yonge Street but you would never know it. The subway is a less than five minute walk from the hotel. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was a good size for 2 people and was spotless. I am particularly picky about cleanliness but I have no complaints. I look forward to my future stays! :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Nicky S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a find ! It is located at Yonge and Bloor, so is pretty much in the heart of downtown Toronto, walking distance to Eaton Centre, Yorkville etc... I have stayed at this location a couple of times and continue to do so. The rooms were cleaned well, the staff was courteous and there are a lot of amazing restaurants nearby. So if you are on a budget (no frills) and would like a clean room at a good location then this is your best bet. Also there is a starbucks right across the street, which was awesome lol !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great people at front desk and housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Jill B
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I (5 of us) stayed for the weekend and found the staff all very friendly and helpful. A damaged shower head was repaired right away - on a Saturday night. We were impressed with that service. Although the bathroom was really small, the room was spacious and clean. The price was right. And the restaurant "Wish" next door turned out to be a gem. Great food and service there too.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms , shame about the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Suma16
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable room and stay here recently but were not comfortable about the neighbourhood. We woke on our first morning to find druggies on the spare ground below our window and people sleeping rough. The second night there was terrible arguing and fighting going on outside which disturbed our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: This is a fine choice for people on a budget. The lobby and elevators have recently been re-done and are quite nice. The hotel is sort of run-down and shabby with dingy hallways and stained carpets. The rooms are surprisingly spacious but don't expect the amenities you might find in one of the more upscale locations. There are some drawbacks to this property, though. Firstly, it's pretty tough to get into since it's on a narrow, one-way street. You pretty much have to pull onto the sidewalk to check in. Secondly, the parking lot underneath the hotel is very small and usually full but there's a spacious municipal lot across the street that is reasonably priced. On the other hand, the high-speed internet is free and the hotel is surprisingly close to some nice restaurants. If you're on a budget and are looking for a place to stay that's close to downtown amenities, this might be a good choice for you. Just don't expect more than its two-star rating can deliver

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessary Mistakes”
Reviews.Author: AllAboard
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located near bus and train lines, rooms appeared clean and were larger than expected although bathrooms were MUCH smaller than expected. Room wall paint and trim were in definite need of refurbishing. Air conditioner was a wall unit which was on all the time, but was loud and barely cooled the room, even at full throttle. Hallways were dingy and not air conditioned, and were very stuffy. Elevators often had water on the floor....maybe due to the fact that ice was only located on one or two floors....it was a 10+ story building....and people simply weren't careful????? Staff were mostly friendly, although one or two were less than friendly. On arrival, we had a reservation issue whereby they could not find us in the system even with a confirmation sheet in hand. We were there on business and were to stay almost a week, and it took them several days to get it straightened out with the proper rate....the rate had apparently changed, and they did not want to honor the rate as noted on our confirmation. Additionally, until they straightened it out, they put us on a day-to-day basis, which meant our computerized room key kept expiring at the proposed check-out time and we had to stand in line to get it re-programmed. Lines were often long, even with only one or two guests waiting as there was usually only one desk clerk on duty....there appeared to be numerous "situations" that often required lengthy dealings. One last comment, there was complimentary coffee available in the lobby area; however, other than early morning, it always seemed to be empty. On two occasions when I asked if it was going to be refilled, I was told that it would be "shortly," or "when we get a chance." After waiting 15 minutes, I gave up on one occasion and came back an hour later....still was not done. On the second occasion, the clerk seemed to speak with a bit of an attitude, so I didn't bother to wait. Three of the clerks I spoke with said they had just started, and were there less than two weeks, and did not know how to answer certain questions, or how to deal with some situations. The hotel is are apparently experiencing some inside issues that most definitely need to be resolved. Overall, stay was adequate, but some things could have been avoided with a little more training or attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great large clean hotel in downtown toronto - can't beat the price.”
Reviews.Author: kenyhz
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge and I couldn't believe the price. I was hesitant after reading some bad reviews but decided to go with all the good reviews to make my choice to stay. I'm glad I did because the room was very satisfactory if you don't need 5 star. It was standard but clean and comfortable. Don't listen to the bad reviews by those people who so picky that nothing will satisfy them. The hotel is around the corner from the metro (and high-end shopping district - holt renfrew) And the neighbourhood is safe. Yes there is a strip place around the corner but...you are in downtown toronto after all. If you don't want to pay outrageous prices to be in the middle of downtown, and just want a good basic place to sleep...this is the place for you.. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “been here before”
Reviews.Author: Antinmelb
Reviews.Content: I have been here before, both times i have found the rooms to be very roomy and comfortable for the price. Position for me was good and lots of eateries nearby. The elevators have been upgraded since i was there last, and they were bringing in many new mattresses while I was there this time. A huge plus for free internet. Two things though, one the king room is dearer than the twin and with one person the cheaper option is ok. second, The staff need to be a bit more attentive sometimes the communication seemed a bit off, but they were trying to be helpful. yes I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “OK I suppose”
Reviews.Author: kettlecharlie
Reviews.Content: I had 12 marvellous days with friends in Halifax NS and a great rail journey from there to Montreal and Toronto. I had chosen this hotel because it was just off Yonge near the Bloor intersection and in this way, it was in a good position. I was given and had to pay for a double room. So, I do think solo travellers are discriminated against. Why can't hotels have single rooms? The shower produced only cold water and I mentioned this to the desk clerk but she was Asian and possibly a recent Canadian.Her English was not as good as it should have been in this position. Breakfast was perfunctory but it was there!

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious room for Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: lovebossa
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my stay in Toronto, so I booked this room through Hotwire. I got it for $70/night! I have never stayed at Comfort Inn and honestly I was a little hesitant to stay here after reading other people's reviews on Tripadvisor. This is a two-star hotel, so I was not expecting much. But the stay was very nice and comfortable! The front desk people were very friendly, and the room was very spacious. (Much more spacious than the three-star hotel in Toronto!) It's very basic, minimum, and zero details but I would not expect that at a two-star hotel. The location is superb, and it was very clean and comfortable! I parked at a parking structure across the street. It was around $20/day. Not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “People were very curteous and the hotel was extremely clean.”
Reviews.Author: Rine123
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay at this hotel again. The location was great and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for weekend”
Reviews.Author: CanningMArk
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, very spacy and comfy beds. HOWEVER, rooms are smoking, so even if you are a non-smoker, the rooms stink of smoke. We had the window open all weekend trying to clear the smell, but it was still very noticable. Other than that, nice spot, close to amenities and subway, and we had a basic breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been worse”
Reviews.Author: gibbs070
Reviews.Content: Across the street from a strip club and it sounded like strippers were doing business above until 3am each night-banging and partying. Front desk wasn't any help. I personally had to go up and try and stop noise-no effect Parking on premises is small and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JudyandDave
Reviews.Content: Very good location with a standard clean and quiet room. Very small (but adequate) Continental breakfast at next door restaurant. Parking in basement is an extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean quiet rooms, average service.”
Reviews.Author: iwaswayoff
Reviews.Content: At $140 per night this hotel would be great value. But ended up paying $250. At that rate you would expect 4 star service, but the guy behind the counter seemed bothered by any questions or requests. The check in the other hand was fine so I guess we cant blame a hotel on a bad experience with one staff. The rooms are large and comfortable, if a little outdated. Cant beat the location really. My advice, if you can get the room for under $150 its great, if not, stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: R4di4ntBabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed there many times with outstanding amazing service all the time. Staff are very friendly, helpful and very courteous to myself and friends that I was travelling with. It's a definite must I recommend, where else is better to have convience and price being right! With the addition of such amazing staff!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: great location, very convenient to public transportation and city center. room was very large, was clean and well heated. bed was a little hard for my taste. bathroom facilities, etc., seemed a little older, but clean & functional. free wifi worked great (important!). good rate, great location, and comfortable stay. nice staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MarianneRose
Reviews.Content: The positives: hotel location is convenient, within walking distance of many main attractions. While the hotel is dated, the bed was comfortable and the noise was minimal given the downtown location. The not-so-positives: booking a room with a king bed and being registered in a room with two double beds ('Oh, sorry.') and having to move without any offer of assistance ('No, I cannot take your new key to you. You will have to come to the front desk.'), a five day struggle with internet connection (the offer of a room change did not come until the fourth day of a five day stay with internet never becoming available), a twice-clogged toilet with the only offer of assistance being the handing over of a dirty plunger (and I mean dirty, toilet tissue from the previous plunge still attached, impudent reception staff who in addition to repeatedly contradicting themselves trying to cover for their poor service as well as the poor service of their colleagues, and inadequate room cleaning. I think the greatest insult was repeatedly being told that I wasn't using my laptop properly. The hotel is not clean. Our bathroom floor was not washed for the duration of our visit. Our room was not cleaned on the fourth day, despite our direct exchange with cleaning staff in the hallway indicating that we were leaving and that the room was free for cleaning. Of great safety concern is the failure of the front desk to answer the phone. After a certain number of rings, the call is dropped. When I asked about what to do in the case of an emergency, I was advised to call 911. My emergency was a plumbing problem. Irritating to say the least. Response: 'Oh I knew you called but I must have been doing something else.'

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: homelovertu
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent few blocks form eaton center Yorkville subway Just check with the staff on how to move around using publictransit HUGE savingson Taxi fares. Neat good rateand Freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Located at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Lau_1988
Reviews.Content: The front desk was willing to listen to our reasoning for a low price and came to a conclusion that suited our budget. The room is not that big, but for the price, i can accept it. We had the smoking room so i would expect the room to smell just as bad as the hallway on the floor, but to my surprise the room didn't smell like anything but fresh. upon check out i took noticed that the location of this hotel is convenient. Many restaurants close by, the subway station just 2 minutes away, the bank was right across from yonge, and whatever else i needed was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for touring downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jessica528
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent for the price. Clean, small beds and Bathrooms. Good hotel if you are spending most of your time touring Toronto. Front desk staff are helpful and very bilingual. Internet doesn't work well in hotel, must sit down in the Lobby to access it. Only one block from closest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in every way but not as bad...”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at this hotel last week so I thought I would join the crowd and give my thoughts here. I have read all the good and bad reviews before arrival so I was not expecting much, but since I was only going to be here for two nights and the price is cheap, I'll live with it. The bad. Much like some of the negatibve reviews indicated, this hotel is cheap in almost every single way - from the condition of the room, floor, decor to facilities, you name it. They call this a 3-star hotel but it certainly feels more like a 2-star or perhaps even 1.5 star by some people's standard. The only "polished" area is the hotel lobby so it is easy to get a false impression. I was put on the 10th floor where the hallway looked old, dark and somewhat filthy so I was a bit concerned about the room. However, I was not as displeased as I thought I would be when I walked into the guestroom - the room actually is quite spacious and the beds are clean. Yes it is an older room with absolutely no frill and the bathroom is cramped, but for 95 CAD a night with free internet during the high season, this room is acceptable. I guess you get what you pay for after all. Now the good. Just to be fair, this hotel is in a fantastic location, only 1.5 block away from the Bloor/Yonge subway station, less than one block from Church/Wellesley Village and about 100 feet from Yonge St. Tons of shops and eateries around the area - everything is just winthin easy walking distance. The Toronto subway system is very simple to figure out and runs along Yonge St. Hence any hotel locates on or right off Yonge St. is a big plus. BTW, if you drive into town, use the parking garage across the street which will I believe will cost you less than the hotel parking. I agree with many people this hotel is definitely not the most ideal. But if you are looking for a hotel in a fantastic location with a bargain price and basically just a clean comfortable room/bed to sleep in, this is really not a terrible choice as some people suggested here. I will recommend it to people with a limited budget on hotel accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Well, at least they get comfort right”
Reviews.Author: somegirlwhotravels
Reviews.Content: Wasn't thrilled with this place. Cleaning staff are not courteous at all. The way they move things can make them fall to the ground, like they don't care about your things. My friend's perfume was moved in a way that looked like it could fall, and toothbrush was under the mirror on the sink (in a crevice), which you can tell it was pushed there because she was cleaning with a cloth and didn't care to pick it up. Also the inside of mugs were wet, which is weird. This place is not courteous to your belongings and doesn't appear to be very clean. The beds are comfortable at least. Nothing amazing, but relative to the rest it's the only thing that stands out. Wifi is included.

Reviews.Title: “Bad room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: AleTravelBR
Reviews.Content: - They put me in a smoker room even though I'm not a smoker and my travel agency always send my room preferences (they even blamed the travel agency - it is a world class agency and I travel more than 100 days/year and never had this problem) - The curtains doesn't properly block the sunlight. Forget the alarm clock, you'll be awake anyway. - The laundry service took 3 days to return my clothes. I had to buy new clothes to use during the week. - The internet does not work in every room and even in the lobby the connection is faulty

Reviews.Title: “terrible and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: terrible69
Reviews.Content: we came to toronto to see Grease at the canon theatre and needed to be close by, we arrived and very unfriendly greeting and then found out a extra 20.00 fee to park in a tiny cramped underground garage which is only first come basis after you pay . you would be out of luck, then our room bathroom not clean and under the edge of our bed the guest prior to us had left a dirty and soiled nightgown. when reported to the front desk, it was an accident, this was not a pleasant experience at all. i would like to say that when we arrived and left if someone had of spoken kindly to us it would have made all the difference in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with the heat”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Explorer47
Reviews.Content: We found lower prices here compared to the high priced hotel we had stayed in before but this time we'd call it the DIScomfort hotel. One of my colleagues had a room that was so warm he couldn't sleep. He couldn't open the window either. My room was cold almost all the time. There was heat in the rad for about two hours on the first morning but the rest of the time it was cold.. With a snowstorm outside there was a strong, cold wind blowing directly through the air conditioning unit. The floor was very cold. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,great location,friendly peopleand great price”
Reviews.Author: S_Navnit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Hotel downtown a party of six and had three rooms. We were very happy with our accomodation which was clean and not expensive at all.The best thing is the location near subway makes it very convenient to go around in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel- Blood on the Bedspread and it wasn't mine!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer176
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but that's where the good news stops! The carpet in my room had some sort of plastic or other "squeaky" material directly underneath so when you walked on it, you felt like you were walking on a plastic drop cloth. When I plugged the TV in, a spark came out of the socket, making me immediately check the fire escape route! The bedspread on the 2nd bed had a big, fresh, and obvious bloodstain on it, and I just checked in! I had an event that night at Queen's Park and had no time to spare, otherwise, I would have left. The next morning, upon attempting to check out, I waited 15 minutes for someone to shwo up at the front desk. There was no one in sight. No bell for service, nothing. (And I came home with a copy of someone else's bill stapled to mine!) Good thing I had left plenty of time before leaving for the airport! This hotel, while very reasonable for business travellers who try to keep costs down, is not worth the "horribleness" of the accomodation. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Know it is not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: unsavvytraveler
Reviews.Content: Based on the information at the website, including that the "newly renovated hotel rooms are well appointed," the inclusion of a free breakfast, and with places like China Town "close by," we decided to stay in this hotel. The rooms are not "newly renovated." The surprise on the faces of the clerks when I asked for a different room to meet this bill was palpable. They thought I had the wrong website and hotel. Yes, there were a few updates. The bathroom was relatively new as well as the wallpaper. The beds were fabulous. No one would describe the "room" as "newly renovated." Nor is it well-maintained. A light fixture was broken in the room and a electrical socket literally hanging out of the wall, mold was in the bathtub, the floor was badly warped in spots, the door had to be shoved to close, and the air conditioner literally fell to pieces when I made an adjustment to the vent (which gave me a good laugh). Yes, the bathrooms are miniscule but we knew that ahead of time. As to location, it is a mixed bag. The immediate area is very seedy, with a lot of strip joints. True, it is not the fault of the hotel, but don't look straight ahead when you walk out of the front door or you will see one strip joint across the street. On the other hand, around the corner was the theatre with the Sound of Music. And it IS only a few blocks from Yorkville and the Royal Ontario Museum. It is not "close by" many of the other locations mentioned on the website, unless you want to walk a long, long way (we exhausted our teens the first day when we tried), or take the subway (WHICH SAVED US BECAUSE THEY ARE WONDERFUL & FIXED LOW PRICED FOR FAMILIES ON WEEKENDS!) or a taxi. Don't expect any benefit from any promotion with a "free breakfast." It was literally dark water coffee and old toast in the Japanese Restaurant that is part of the hotel. The staff of the restaurant was sullen. It was almost insulting. I would never eat dinner in this restaurant based on the "breakfast" experience. The front desk staff, if they could be deemed "concierge," had virtually no knowledge of how to get anywhere in Toronto or of the tourist spots, though they were very polite and tried to be helpful. However, the hotel discount tickets for ROM and other spots were wonderful. We had a excellent package to see the Dead Sea Scrolls. If you check in early enough to get one of the few coveted parking spots with in and out privileges, it is very convenient. Be careful for the bottom of your car over that bump! This hotel could be nice with more work and better maintenance to the rooms, better staff, better breakfasts, and a truthful ad. Okay, a different hotel would be a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great.”
Reviews.Author: cuteontariocouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night to attend a conference nearby. The location was great, only 1 block form Yonge & Bloor. We were glad for that because it was very cold so we didnâ€™t have to walk far. I was a little nervous about this place based on previous reviews but if youâ€™re looking for a cheap room in a good location and go in with low expectations itâ€™s not bad at all. We tried to reserve parking when we booked but they said it is first come-first served because the lot is small. They werenâ€™t kidding! Getting in and out with a mini van was an adventure. The parking cost was $19 but they let us leave the car there from 9pm until 6pm the next day. The parking system is weird: you have to check in â€“ thereâ€™s nowhere to legally park or stop while you do â€“ and then drive to the parking entrance and use the phone on the wall to call the front desk to let you in. The garage is tiny, probably fits about 20 cars. There is a large public garage across the street too if thereâ€™s no room left. The main lobby is nice, looks like it has been renovated. Service at the front desk was very good. The clerk gave my colleague and me rooms on the 7th floor. When I checked into mine it was overly warm and smelled a little musty. I turned off the heat as best I could and opened the window even though it was minus16c outside. I left it open all night and was still a little warm. There are 2 small beds with older linens, a tv on a stand, dresser, table, 2 chairs. The room was pretty big but the bathroom was absurdly tiny. The tub was barely a tub at all. For one person it was enough room. It was relatively clean but this is an older hotel and not exactly fancy. Anyone looking for more than the basic amenities should go elsewhere. My colleague didnâ€™t have as much luck with her room. It was about 30 degrees C in there and reeked of cigarette smoke even though this was a non-smoking floor. Due to the temperature and the smell it was disgusting and uninhabitable. She went down to the lobby and the clerk switched her to the 8th floor to a less stinky room and she was satisfied with that. The elevator is very old and lurch-y but works. There is a sushi/teppanyaki restaurant in the hotel that advertised breakfast. Donâ€™t bother. There are hundreds of restaurants nearby where youâ€™d be better off. There is a continental breakfast buffet for $6.95 or a bunch of odd menu choices for table service (Huge â€œAmericanâ€� breakfast but no a la carte eggs). For some reason the server added a $1.00 service charge to each bill. We didnâ€™t ask about it but didnâ€™t leave a tip either. The ambiance was unexpectedly nice and it might be ok for lunch or dinner but breakfast was not their strength. Overall I would recommend this hotel if youâ€™re on a tight budget. It was only $79 for the night and the location is really excellent, but you get what you pay for. If you donâ€™t need to be in a certain location, you can probably get a deal on a much nicer room elsewhere for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Would not choose again”
Reviews.Author: Spilary
Reviews.Content: Several problems with this hotel. Walked in and both bedspreads in my double room were stained; Burn marks on the carpets; Hot and cold are reversed in the shower and no stopper in the sink.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOSPITALITY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Carrissima
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Hotel is anything but comfortable. We have stayed there two previous times before with no problems, however this hotel chain has definitely gone downhill over the years. When we walked into our guest room after checking in, we were stuck to the floor ... literally. There were sticky spots all thru out. Not only was the carpet sticky, the bathroom did not pass for clean either. However, it was a busy weekend for this hotel as it was Pride Weekend in Toronto, so my Girlfriend and myself put towels on the carpet so we didn't get stuck, and cleaned the bathrooms ourselves. Wasn't too big of a deal, however definitely not what you would expect when walking into a hotel room. However, this isn't the main complaint that we have regarding this hotel. Our problems arose from the lack of customer service that this hotel showed when Customer service should have been the priority. On our second day there, we happened to get stuck in the elevator between the lobby and first floor. Altogether, we had 9 people in the elevator, capacity on license was 12. None of us blame the hotel for the elevator breaking, however the actions taken by the staff from the time the alarm button was pushed to the time of our checkout the following day are their own faults. First and foremost, we had to press and hold the alarm button for minutes before finally the front desk manager came to see what was going on. He then went back to his desk to call Maintenance, which we were advised would be approx. a 40minute wait. Others that came into the hotel went to the front desk and advised them that with 9 people stuck in an elevator on a day where temperature was in the 30's was unacceptable... that he needed to call Emergency services... This was then done by front desk. During this time, the people in the elevator were resourceful enough to find a lever that opened the bottom door up so that we at least had air. The manager was DEFINITELY neglect in not pointing this out to us. He should have been aware of all procedures that should be followed in an emergency situation. We had to pass our room key thru the bottom crack to people down below who then walked up the four flights to our room for water for us, as again...it was very hot and there was NINE people in there. After they returned with drinks for us, the manager then came to the elevator with FOUR bottles of water. Hmmm, Four bottles, for nine people... LOL You gotta be kidding me! We waited for the fire department, who showed up about 30 minutes into this. They finally got the door above us opened so that we could crawl up and out. However, we had to wait an additional 10 minutes for the hotel to FIND a ladder... Once we were out, 7 of us went to our room in the hotel. The manager did not even once contact our room to make sure everyone was o.k. Definitely Not customer service. On day of checkout, the same manager was working front desk. As we approached, he asked us how our stay was!!!!!! ( Didn't even recognize us...) When advised that we were stuck in his elevator the day prior, he asked us "Which time?" Again, failing to show any customer service on his part. He told me what my bill was, and was advised by us that that was not acceptable. We were not going to pay full price, not after the lack of concern shown by the hotel. We were guests, we paid for a service, and definitely did not receive it. He argued with us that he wasn't able to do anything, I advised him that something would need to be done. After arguing back and forth, he finally said he would give us 50% off .. I said, 50% off both nites, meaning one nite would be free, he said "No, only off Saturday nite." He then advised me that there were 12 people in the elevator and that's why it got stuck. We let him know that we had been in the elevator long enuff to count the people numerous times, and there were 9 of us. Although, even if there had been 12, the license on the elevator itself stated capacity was TWELVE!!!!! Therefore, even if he was correct, we should have still been fine. (Day of check out tho, there were signs posted at elevator saying only 6 at a time... handwritten.) We ended up leaving as we didn't appreciate being told we were liars...as well as we didn't appreciate his lack of respect for us, his paying guests. The day after we got home, we then sent off a lengthy email to the hotel as well as to the Comfort Hotels main website letting them know of our experience. After waiting three days, we still had heard nothing. We then forwarded the same email to not only the original recipients, but to also three other email addresses found off other websites for the Comfort Hotel Chains. We then received a response telling us that the email was being directed to the proper department and that we would be hearing something shortly from them. Which, we did. We received an email asking for mailing address and phone numbers. We responded with the information that was requested and heard nothing again from them. We then forwarded all the emails back, advised them that the Comfort definitely is not Customer Service oriented hotel, and asked when something else would be heard. We then received another email stating that it was back in the hands of the hotel where we stayed and that we should expect to receive something in the mail. We were elated when 3 days later we did receive a letter informing us that they were going to rebate us the additional money that we had paid for the Saturday nite. Giving us one nite free after all this hassle. This was just a form letter, and now... over a week later, and a voicemail and another email sent still nothing has been heard. Very poor customer service. Please be forewarned, and stay elsewhere! The Comfort Hotel would possibly learn from the dictionary definition of GUEST... â€“noun 1. a person who spends some time at another person's home in some social activity, as a visit, dinner, or party. 2. a person who receives the hospitality of a club, a city, or the like. 3. a person who patronizes a hotel, restaurant, etc., for the lodging, food, or entertainment it provides. Definitely not an enjoyable experience. Definitely not worth paying to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Favorite”
Reviews.Author: yqq990
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in the last six months. Rooms are clean and comfortable (I always get a suite for the fridge and microwave), but baths are tiny. Location is excellent for my needs. The on-site garage is miniscule, but there's a nice public garage across the street for $15/day, which I think is very reasonable for a prime urban location. (And it fits my Navigator, which some of the top hotels do not!)

Reviews.Title: “Bad!”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeN
Reviews.Content: The location is probably the only good thing about this hotel. We made our reservation through Expedia with a request for a King size bed if available at check-in. Upon checkin, Ana the front desk agent seemed tired, overworked and in a terrible mood. She had not read the request, and the only answer she could give was that the hotel was full and no changes were possible. OK point taken! She then handed me keys that did not work. I had to walk back down to the desk to get them replace. No apologies from her. Later, I needed to access the 'Free Wireless Internet Access'. That did not work from the room. I had to walk down to the desk, be told by Ana that 'I must be doing something wrong'. The hotel connected me with the technical support desk of their internet provider, with whom I had to resolve the issue myself. In any case, there was still no access from the room - only from the lobby. The bathroom was dirty. They were marks of urine on the toilet seat. The sink was wobbly, the bath tub had dirt marks, the shower head had no pressure, a light bulb was broken in the bathroom and we had to ask for a replacement. Overall this was not good value for money. We do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfamily
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights here so we could attend the CNE. It was a last minute booking and it was tricky for us to find as Charles is a one way street - we didn't turn when we should so we had to circle around a bit. Once found, I was a little dubious just looking at the outside of it. But once inside, all those doubts went away. Beautiful, professional looking lobby. A great reception from the desk clerk, she offered us a view of the park from the 10th floor. We went upstairs to find the room - beautiful! Big! and lovely. Lots of room to move around, unlike a stay at another hotel in Toronto. Excellent location to get to the subway at Bloor and Yonge (Just look for The Bay - its right inside). There are lots of coffee places in the area that we tried for breakfast - we didn't choose to go to the restraunt downstairs from the hotel but ventured out instead. Restraunts along Yonge as well - easy to walk to. I'll add this is a gay friendly area too. While there are adult bookstores in the area, and a nude dancing parlor across the street (not a brothel as someone mentioned, and its set back quite a ways so its not in your face) we felt quite safe in the area. There is nearby shopping and a walk thru the park is lovely. Excellent location. You'll find indoor basement parking - it was $19 a night for us, but just be aware there are only 20 spaces. Bring your smallest car too - its a little tight. I did notice a big public garage across the street and I suspect (but do check) if they fill you can park there as well. Beds are very comfortable. Bathroom is small, but beautifully decorated. Only slight inconvenience is where the toilet paper holder is - its behind you so you really have to reach. Showers were great. Our outlet didn't work in the bathroom - there are few outlets in the entire room - when I mentioned it to the desk, it was addressed that day. Nightlight provided was a nice touch. Windows on the park side provide a excellent view of the buildings at night. The price was very reasonable. I'd highly recomend staying here, with kids or not, and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel - Even the Rats Like It !!!”
Reviews.Author: RescueTeam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my wife's parents 10 day stay while visiting from England to see their new great grand-daughter. We selected this hotel because we stay at Comfort Inn's regularly, and for it's GREAT LOCATION. Prior to booking a room, we checked out the hotel . The building looks old on the outside, but surprisingly clean and recently renovated on the inside. The location can't be beat. You are a few steps from the subway, and only a block from the centre of the city, Bloor & Yonge. On the third night of their stay, they found a visitor in their room...A RAT! A quick call to the front desk had them relocated to a suite, which they remained in at no extra cost for the remaining 6 nights. The staff are very professional, and willing assist with any request. However, due to it's downtown location, and it's close proximity to numerous restaurants, perhaps an exterminator should be added to their staff. Overall, a pleasant stay with one understandable but distressing, problem, professionally handled.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't like mice DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: lema7777
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for nine nights in september 2006. when we first went into the hotel we were pleased with the look of the reception and the service given at the front desk . we were given a room on the second floor . the room was clean and in great condition but the view from the window was poor we faced onto building and a alley way we then asked if we could face the park . we were given once again great service and given a room on the 8th floor we were very pleased until that night when i saw MICE running about the room floor . i immediatly called the front desk to be told someone would come immediatly i waited 1 hour and called again . the reception guy came up tried to find the mice but he could not he told us the hotel had problems in the past with mice but it had been fixed out we asked to be moved to another room but he said the hotel was full and we would get moved in the morning i told him that i have stayed in many toronto hotels and never had such a problem, he said that he could not understand where the mouse had come from and as much as said we were seeing things . it was now about 11pm and i got up out of bed to go to the bathroom which was near to the room door and when i looked down i saw where the mice were comming from . they were comming from under the room door as the room doors were miss fitting and gaped under i then called reception again and another guy came up and tried to catch it but the mouse escaped under the door we were then given towels and pillows to block the door so the mice could not get in by this time it was 1 am and i was very angry with the situation its bad enough that the previous night i hadnt much sleep as this hotel is so noisy due to the problens with the room doors you have to slam then to close them it was just to much. but any way the manager gave us a upgrade for the rest of our stay after telling us they did have a issue with mice due to building work being done near by and it only effected the lower floors but pest control had been called . the funny thing was after telling us that he offerd us the same type of room 2 floors under we had to fight to be upgraded. and we are still waiting to be refunded one nights stay 1 month on POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM THE MANAGER WHO ASSURED US WE WOULD BE REFUNDED . this hotel has clean rooms BUT MICE

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Matt59
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by the quality. This class of hotel in the states can mean literally anything is possible. Check in, staff, cleanliness, room amenities, water pressure, mattress, etc... were all a great surprise. The location is perfect and within easy walking distance of Yonge and Bloor. Subway station is right there too if you don't want to walk to the shopping and nightlife that is south. Very good neighborhood. And for some odd reason, one of the few hotels to have king beds. Several only seem to offer doubles only due to their very small room size.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Truckman-Mick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, allthough I had to move rooms after the first night, due to all night noise from water pipes and boiler. The other room was a lot better. It was clean and comfortable with all the amenities you could ask for in a hotel room. The location could be a bit better. It was a long walk to the city centre, allthough the subway system was very excellent for getting round. There was a subway station across the road from the hotel and it was around 5 stops to the city centre itself, and around 7 or 8 stops to the CN Tower and the waterfront. The hotel staff were friendly and helpfull. All in all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside warm and clean on the inside”
Reviews.Author: mattymichaels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March (which by the way was FREEZING!). I had booked this hotel as part of a last minute package and didn't read the reviews on this site until way after I had paid; so was a little worried when I did! Have to say though that this hotel was really very good. OK, it's not much to look at from the outside, but it more than makes up for it inside. Rooms are large and clean. Given the price it was more than either of us expected. Our room was right outside the lift but neither of us had any issues with this it was pretty quiet. Huge walk in style wardrobe, big bathroom and bigger than average double bed. The maid came every day and the room was always spotless. One very slight incident which confused us more than angered us - about 08.30am one morning an â€˜engineerâ€™ tried to get into the room (without knocking) and then, when he found it locked started constantly knocking. He shouted out from the other side of the door that he wanted to 'take our beds away'???! We just said that we were in the bed and wanted it to stay in the room and he went away. I checked with the reception to see if this guy was for real and they confirmed that they were replacing beds on our floor and apologised for trying to remove ours with us still in it (as well as the rudeness of the bed snatcher). Location wise this hotel is fantastic. You are right opposite the tube (give or take the car park which you have to walk through for a few seconds). The area seemed very safe - we returned back pretty late nearly every night and all was well. We were able to walk up to the Eden Centre (big shopping centre) in about 20-25 mins which was fine with us. My overall comment would be that this is a great hotel in a central location; it's cheap, spacious and clean. It isn't overly pretty but if youâ€™re just planning to sleep there then....!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Comfort hotel downtown with my girlfriend and her parents. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Air conditioning was perfect. The hotel is renovated and the corridors are bright. The location is very convenient and the good thing, it is not expensive. The new teppenyaki Restaurant serves good food and the decor is great .The staff is friendly and service prompt. I will stay again and recommend it to others .

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: jf1_hull
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is cheap but you get what you pay for. I was on the second floor and you could hear the subway every five minutes. In addition, there is a construction site behind the hotel, so every morning at around six o'clock, trucks are lined up and you hear bip bip bip so truck are backing up in the driveway... On the better side, you have access to the subway within seconds and there are a few restaurants nearby (excellent asian soup spot on the corner of Charles and Younge) and shop on Bloor West. But for the rest forget it stay anywhere else if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Hotel Downtown for 2 days and couldn't wait to leave! I was put in a room next to the elevator. You could hear the doors opening and closing everytime! The room (Non-smoking) smelled like stale cigars and mold. The bathroom was very small and dirty. Next to the toilet was what looked like years of dirty and scum. I don't even want to know what was all over the shower curtain! No soap was avaible in the shower, I ran out of toilet paper and had to call the front desk for a replacement! Let's just say I will never ever stay at this hotel again. If you are thinking of staying here I wouldn't! If you want to see pics of the hotel room I took digital pics as proof!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: hoffman_david
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent place to stay if you're on a budget. We stayed in a 5th floor room with 2 double beds for $99 Canadian. On arrival we were given a smoking room despite having reserved nonsmoking. The clerk sincerely apologized, but they had no nonsmoking rooms available. To compensate us for that, he gave us the rollaway bed we needed for free. The room didn't actually stink of smoke, so we kept it despite being offered a new room for the second night. The room was basic but clean. The bathroom was quite tiny with no counter space (just a small shelf on the wall). There was a coffee pot in the room which was fine, but to my dismay on morning #2 the maid didn't replace the coffee! We also had some trouble getting enough towels, but again the staff was polite and (sort of) accomodating - I finally got the towels by walking down to the housekeeping office. The hotel isn't in the greatest neighborhood if you have kids. The strip club advertising Miss Nude Greece across the street, as well as the condom shop around the corner, took some explaining. Then again, it's all part of the "big city" experience, right?

Reviews.Title: “far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I saw my room first I couldn't believe it. I never had so much space for only ca. 70 EUR per night. I stayed there three nights alone and then my family joined me for another three nights and still we had enough space. The hotel has been renovated early in 2003, so some of the older complaints might no longer be true. I found the hotel clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. And don't forget about the location: Right around the corner there are Bloor St. and Yonge St., two places you shouldn't miss when traveling to Toronto. The hotel, however, is quiet, so you can easily relax from days and nights in this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights at the Comfort Hotel. The first night we were on the 10th (top) floor and they stuck us next to the elevator...my bed felt every move the elevator made. We requested another room which we were given rather easily. The "new" room was not much nice, but it was away from the elevator. The continental breakfast was a sad sight...a shot of OJ and a peice of toast was not what was expected. The best part of the hotel was that it was near the subway station. I will find another hotel for my next trip to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are somewhat deceiving. When we arrived, we wondered if we had the right place..not the nicest location. The rooms were just OK. We had a room with 2 double beds, one mattress was bellied. The bathroom had signs of mildew aroung the sink & shower and the finish was chipped on the tub. Another couple had a suite and that was nicer. Parking provided for an extra fee.
